meanings.definition: The act of increasing in intensity or severity.
meanings.sent1: The escalation of the argument made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The escalation of prices at the store was unexpected.
meanings.sent3: The escalation of the food fight was both messy and hilarious.
meanings.sent4: The escalation of tension in the room was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The escalation of the storm made it impossible to go outside.

meanings.sent1: The sudden escalation of the stock market surprised investors.
meanings.sent2: The escalation of COVID-19 cases is concerning.
meanings.sent3: The escalation of the balloon race was thrilling to watch.
meanings.sent4: The escalation of emotions in the movie was gripping.
meanings.sent5: The escalation of the music volume made it hard to concentrate.
